ca.mcgill.ecse211.team14.finalproject

Class LightLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team14.finalproject.LightController
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team14.finalproject.LightLocalizer

  • public class LightLocalizer
extends LightController
    This class contains methods needed for light sensor localization. These methods guide the robot to travel to the waypoint (1,1) after ultrasonic localization. The robot turns 360 degrees around itself and detect four black lines in the process. The Theta reading when these lines are touched are stored into an array. Then error in X, Y, Theta odometer readings are adjusted by calculated values. Finally, the robot navigates to (1,1) again in main class and the main class should use reOrient() method to orient itself towards 0 degree axis.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightLocalizer

        public LightLocalizer()

    • Method Detail

      • localize

        public void localize()
        This method controls how the robot moves when using the light sensor to localize. The robot would turn around for 360 degrees and then stop. After that, it will adjust the odometer readings based on theta reading when black lines are met.

      • orientTo0

        public void orientTo0()
        At the end of light localization, orient robot back to 0 degrees w.r.t the Y-axis.

      • processData

        public void processData(int curIntensity)
        Process data fetched from light sensor. The boolean lineTouched is set either true or false based on current intensity. And if the boolean localizerStarted is true, the theta reading will be stored into intersectionDegrees.
        Parameters:
        curIntensity -

      • getLineTouched

        public boolean getLineTouched()
        Getter method for boolean lineTouched.
        Returns:
        value of boolean lineTouched

      • setlocalizerStarted

        public void setlocalizerStarted(boolean input)
        Setter method for boolean localizerStarted.
        Parameters:
        input -
